meanings.definition: The act of lying in wait to attack by surprise.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers set up ambushments in the forest to surprise the enemy.
meanings.sent2: The ambushments by the river caught the travelers off guard.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox used the ambushments to trick the rabbits during their game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like hidden ambushments, waiting to catch you off guard.
meanings.sent5: The ambushments in the tall grass were as silent as shadows, ready to pounce.

meanings.definition: A surprise attack from a concealed position.
meanings.sent1: The bandits planned their ambushments along the narrow path.
meanings.sent2: The ambushments in the dark alley took the townspeople by surprise.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon's ambushments on the picnic basket were foiled by a watchful dog.
meanings.sent4: His words were like unexpected ambushments, catching her off guard.
meanings.sent5: The ambushments in the fog were like ghosts, striking fear into the hearts of the villagers.
